task.title: Adding a Favicon in WebHelp Systems

context.p: You can add a custom favicon to your WebHelp system by simply editing a template in an XSL file. To add a favicon, follow these steps:

step.cmd: Edit the following XSL file for DITA or DocBook WebHelp systems:

substep.cmd: For DITA WebHelp systems, edit the following file: [OXYGEN_DIR]\frameworks\dita\DITA-OT\plugins\com.oxygenxml.webhelp\xsl\createMainFiles.xsl.
For DocBook WebHelp system, edit the following file: [OXYGEN_DIR]\frameworks\docbook\xsl\com.oxygenxml.webhelp\xsl\createMainFiles.xsl.

step.cmd: Locate the following template in the XSL file: <xsl:template name-"create-toc-common-file">.
Add two link elements inside the head element, as in the following example:

info.codeblock: <link rel="icon" href="/favicon.ico" type="image/x-icon" /> <link rel="shortcut icon" href="/favicon.ico" type="image/x-icon" />

step.cmd: Save your changes to the file.
Re-run your WebHelp system transformation scenario.
